name: Hever Castle Bed and Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Out of this world. Very romantic place for a stay. Service was friendly and welcoming. The Astor wing is not situated in the castle itself but was built adjoining it by Jacob Astor so that friends and family could stay in luxurious accommodation.
reviews.title: Lap of luxury

reviews.text: We recently went to a close friends wedding here which was absolutely lovely in an amazing location. We also were lucky enough to stay in one of the rooms overnight (we also sussed out the bridal suite and a couple of other friends rooms - all lovely) which was very sumptious, like the rest of the venue. The decor was finished perfectly, keeping traditional charm with a modern twist. A definite must to stay here again in the future!
reviews.title: Brilliant wedding venue and wonderful rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our second visit to Hever, in December, staying in their guest wing was just as perfect as our first, soon after they opened. Like us, I doubt that you’ll only visit Hever Castle once. There’s something special about sleeping in the fabulously restored, Astor Wing, quite apart from the sumptuous, historic accommodation, the staff are truly delightful, each and every one. On our first visit, we were thrilled to be served breakfast in the Great Hall, not an everyday occasion, even at the castle. The grounds are gorgeous, there’s a large boating lake, a water maze, abundant flowers, shrubs and trees, in a variety of settings, together with water features and planting unique to Hever. I adore Hever, the modernity perfectly married with the ancient, supplying this guest with a memorable stay and longing to return. Activities and events too numerous to mention here, are laid on throughout the year, take a look at their website and choose your favourite. We visited in December, so they had erected beautifully decorated Christmas trees, not just one or two, but so many that I lost count, those lining either side of the Gallery, matched for size, looked breathtaking. If you get a chance this year, just stand at one end and try to take it all in. Standing just outside the Keep, was a large tree, branches laden with list labels for Father Christmas. I spent quite a while just reading what people of all ages had written. If you’re passionate about history, particularly Henry VIII’s doomed relationship with Anne Boleyn, Hever is a must, but even if you're not, well, it's a must.
reviews.title: Sumptuous, historic Hever

reviews.text: I took my wife to Hever castle, staying at the hever castle luxury bed and breakfast in their Astor wing for our anniversary.
reviews.title: Romance and beauty and history all in one place

reviews.text: I have to say that it was really excellent. We had a late cancellation and stayed in the rosemary room (apparently the smallest) it was well appointed, cosy and the bed was so comfortable. Second only to the hotel intercontinental de la ville in Rome.
reviews.title: Lovely
This has the 'wow' factor
reviews.text: My husband and I have just returned from a two night stay at this excellent B&B. From the minute you turn into the private drive and are greeted by a member of staff at the door it's very special. We were shown to the Tulip Room and on the way we were shown the lounge, billiard room and where we would be having breakfast in the morning. The Tulip Room was a real wow! It's in the oldest part of the Tudor Village overlooking the ground and a small lake. The large room was beautifully furnished and you felt you had gone back in time. The bathroom was very modern with a lovely large bath and super shower. During the Castle opening hours you can get a meal at the restaurant in the ground. We did a five minute walk to the Henry V111 pub in the village and had two delicious meals there (see review).

Breakfast the first morning was in the Hall in the Tudor Village. It was extremely good with plenty of choice. The second morning we were shown to the Great hall in the Castle. This is a wonderful room but it was very cramped with loads of people. It had been set up with two long tables and by 8.45am was nearly full. The staff did their best but cereals, fruit and fruit juice were not replaced and we had to ask for them. I had kippers which were very nice but not very hot. The normal hall for breakfast had been set up for a wedding and this was why we were in the Great Hall. I'm sure some of the guests were thrilled by it all.
reviews.title: Lovely!

reviews.text: A real bonus staying here is you can enter the grounds before and after the public have left. On our final morning we walked around the grounds and lake before anyone arrived - amazing. I would certainly recommend this wonderful B&B .
reviews.title: magical stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night with our two kids (5 and 10 yrs), in one of the rooms (called "Clover" I think) for a birthday party at the castle. The room added a feeling of being a guest in historic times. The breakfast was impressing (I don't know if that is standard).
reviews.title: WOW

reviews.text: I don't know the price of the room, but I better stay one night here than five nights in a standard hotel.
reviews.title: Don't stay in the Geranium room in the summer!
Incomparable
reviews.text: Until recently only wedding or corporate event guests were able to stay in The Astor Wing at Hever Castle. The refurbished bedrooms are magnificent. Hever Castle is a magical place and staying in The Astor Wing should be on everyone's list of things to do before they die!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is not a lot more to add that hasn`t been said already about this excellent B&B. My wife booked this as a birthday present. It was 5* from the moment we parked the car. Our room "Hazel" was on the first floor. It was spacious with all the usual facitities except a minibar and air-conditioning. There was a well fitted bathroom with bath and a very large shower/wetroom. The staff were courtious, friendly and helpful. The extra treat we enjoyed was breakfast in the Great Hall of the castle. I gathered this didn`t happen often. Included in the deal, is access to the gardens before the public are allowed in as well as entrance to the castle for the duration of stay.
reviews.title: Outstanding B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have you ever dreamed of sleeping in Lord Astor's room at Hever Castle ? This dream could come true if you ask for the "Tulip" room and are lucky enough to get it . It is the most luxurious and impressive bedroom we have ever seen . Residents of the B&B have free access to Hever Castle and the grounds , and have the grounds for their exclusive use after and prior to public access . The excellent breakfast is served by a young and very friendly staff wearing white gloves in just another grand woodpanelled room with a huge fireplace . Hope that my dream will come true again soon .
reviews.title: A dream come true !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my now fiancee had a fantastic stay, it is a very friendly and romantic setting. The rooms are very comfortable and they have not been shy with making the rooms look stunning. The gardens open all hours for guests at the B&B and i stole that oppotunity to propose. The breakfast was absolutly perfect, with great tasting food and location. I would recommend this B&B to any one that is looking for a romantic get away... beats Paris anyday!
reviews.title: Fantastic weekend

reviews.text: Took my mum here for mother's day and she was overwhelmed by the whole experience, three generations had a wonderful time. Staff charming , from the gentleman who met us in the car park to all reception staff. Nothing too much trouble and a very proffesional and personal approach. Amazing Primrose feature room with stunning bathroom and superb breakfast. The snowdrop trail in the exquisite grounds all to ourselves after public access closed was a once in a lifetime experience. I cannot recommend highly enough thank you to all the wonderful people at Hever, you are as exceptional and unique as the beautiful, historic castle and grounds.
reviews.title: Perfect in every way

reviews.text: My fiancé and I stayed here from June 13th to June 15th. It couldn't have been better. Outstanding service, beautiful location, lovely food and the best B&B room we have stayed in. The room was gorgeously decorated, the bathroom was to die for with a huge roll top bath and the view from our room was breath taking. It overlooked the back of the castle and the tudor village. Hever Castle and its grounds are so atmospheric and incredibly beautiful. I am a big Anne Boleyn acolyte and staying here was simply a dream for me. The only thing that impeached on our stay a little is the attitude of some of the other B&B guests. Some were quite rude and very judgemental. For some reason we were given a few dirty looks and talked about very loudly by other guests, which i simply cannot understand as we did nothing untoward or to offend. All i can think of is the fact we are a young couple and my fiancé has alot of tattoos but that doesn't warrant such a reaction. However, this is certainly not the B&B's fault. The staff were always professional, polite and very friendly. It was a pleasure staying here and we cannot wait to return! I would recommend this hotel to friends, family and all trip advisors! Thank you for such a lovely stay Hever!
reviews.title: Magical location, exquisite rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A long weekend stay at the castle was by courtesy of our daughter and son in law as a birthday present. We were greeted in the car park by a very smart young man who took our luggage and showed us to our room - and what a room! Wood panelled walls, ornate ceiling and carvings, leaded windows, spotlessly clean, beautifully decorated and an enormous bed. In contrast the en suite bathroom was ultra modern and strangely enough the two worked well together. The breakfast was only available between 8.30am and 9.30am but it was as good as you get in any top class hotel and served in the beautiful Grand Hall. Having access to the Castle and grounds for the duration of the stay was a bonus too; the opportunity to wander around the grounds on an early summers evening after the public had gone was absolutely magical. The young man I mentioned earlier recommended a local restaurant, the Greyhound, for an evening meal which was fabulous and there is another super pub, King Henry VIII, within walking distance. We spent two wonderful relaxing days exploring the Castle and grounds and also a day at nearby Chartwell House which is also a must. Luxury which doesn't cost a kings ransom.
reviews.title: Fit for a King

reviews.text: This was awesome. It's a wing, built by the Astors in the 20's. Very Tudor-y and atmospheric including the grounds, room and shared areas. I had one of the singles, which was fantastic. The price includes entrance to Hever Castle, and the ability to roam the grounds when the park is closed.
reviews.title: Highlight, wonderful experience, reasonably priced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent the entire day at Hever, walked the lake, tried some archery, had a wonderful breakfast, toured around the AMAZING gardens (the best I saw on my trip) and wrote in the cozy library/music room (fireplace, comfy couches). This has it all...a castle with fascinating history, gardens, beautiful countryside to roam, a wonderful location, and atmospheric, quiet rooms (no one above most of them) etc.
reviews.title: Beautiful, relaxing, great customer service

reviews.text: This was a splurge for me, but worth every penny, and I even extended to another night, so I could really tuck in. Ate down the road at the Henry VIII pub, which was very nice.
reviews.title: Luxurious B and B

aka: Hever Castle Bed And Breakfast Kent, England
